metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8637 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A local information disclosure issue was found in dracut before 045 when generating initramfs images with world-readable permissions when 'early cpio' is used, such as when including microcode updates. Local attacker can use this to obtain sensitive information from these files, such as encryption keys or credentials.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dracut - 044+189-1
dracut-config-generic - 044+189-1
dracut-config-rescue - 044+189-1
dracut-core - 044+189-1
dracut-network - 044+189-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dracut package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '044+189-1').
